brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the potential interactions between intravenous (IV)
      cocaine and tolcapone.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Potential Interactions Between Cocaine and Tolcapone - 1

detailed_description.textblock:
Double-blind, inpatient study by screening responses to cocaine infusions of 20 and 40 mg
      i.v. subjects into 1 of 2 treatment groups to assess potential interactions between i.v.
      cocaine infusion and treatment with tolcapone.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        Volunteers dependent on cocaine and are non-treatment seeking; between 18-45 yrs of age;
        DSM-4 criteria for cocaine abuse or dependence

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Additional criteria available during screening at the site

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Potential Interactions Between Intravenous Cocaine and Tolcapone

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Masking: Double-Blind, Primary Purpose: Treatment
